creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
markings: red artist's seal: 岱紫洞主 {Taishi Dōshu} | publisher seal: 渡辺工 {Watanabe kō} (work of Watanabe) | LRC, artist's hand-applied red approval seal: 名取 {Natori}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
portfolio: Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Twenty-ninth design of a set of 36. Actor Bandō Hikosaburō VI (1886-1938) as Matsuōmaru in the scene Tearing the Carriage Apart (Kurumabiki 車引) of the play Mirror of Learning and Transmitting Sugawara's Secrets of Calligraphy (Sugawara denju tenarai kagami 菅原伝授手習鑑). Matsuōmaru is in the service of the villain Shihei who he must protect from his two brothers trying to avenge their masters.
title: Actor Bandō Hikosaburō VI as Matsuōmaru
